page.title: 11Ardross Castle
page.content: The castle was built between 1838-46, taking eight years to build. It has 98 rooms including bathrooms. In 1910, the owners Perrins (of Lea & Perrins sauces) built a heated swimming pool in the castle. It was intended for th e use of family and guests who got wet and cold whilst out deer-hunting. The largest room was the Great Hall which was used for banquets. There have been many County balls and Celebration balls held in the Great Hall. When the Perrins owned the castle they employed about 22 gardeners and a further 22 staff working in the house. Even today there are still peacocks in the grounds. Decorative turrets were built, but many are false.
